metadata.title: CVE-2012-4405 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple integer underflows in the icmLut_allocate function inInternational Color Consortium (ICC) Format library (icclib), as used inGhostscript 9.06 and Argyll Color Management System, allow remote attackersto cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary codevia a crafted (1) PostScript or (2) PDF file with embedded images, whichtriggers a heap-based buffer overflow. NOTE: this issue is also describedas an array index error.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4405` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

argyll - 1.4.0-7ubuntu1
argyll-ref - 1.4.0-7ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: argyll package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.0-7ubuntu1').
